poem:
Title: "To Borrow is To Grow"

In a world where babes sprout too swift,
Find their coats no longer fit,
Rental remedies make the shift -
Lullaloop, Or Collective, the little kit. 

Subscriptions sweet, small wardrobes renew,
Stella clad in coats anew.
So, here's a thought, simple and true -
In this dance of endless accrue,
To borrow is to grow too.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How rental ‘libraries of things’ have become the new way to save money A year into motherhood and I can confirm two things: babies grow too fast and clothing them is an expensive business. My solution has been to rent my daughter Stella’s wardrobe. Warm coats, swimming costumes, sleepsuits, sandals – all can be borrowed for a monthly subscription from any number of services such as Bundlee, Lullaloop and thelittleloop, amongst others. Through Or Collective,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
